problems.title: Trailing Zeros in Factorial
problems.description:
For a given non-negative integer N, consider N! (N factorial). Your task is to find how many trailing zeros are at the end of the decimal representation of N!.

Input Format:
A single integer N.

Output Format:
Print a single integer, the number of trailing zeros in N!.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
10

Sample Output
2

Explanation:
10! = 3628800 which has 2 trailing zeros.
hintsList: Each trailing zero comes from a factor 10 = 2*5. Count how many times 5 divides N! using n/5 + n/25 + n/125 + ... until the term becomes zero.
